svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
October 14, 2023" date: "2023-10-13"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko .Â Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Devnet 9 testing continues, MEV-Boost testing
started (need to test with blobs) Devnet 10 ideally launches next week, once KZG setup
in CL specs/clients and devnet 9 testing complete EVM Object Format (EOF) status
update Discussions on priorities/timeline for EOF & Verkle, whether to ever include
EOF and L1/L2 EVM divergence
* Devnet 9 testing continues, MEV-Boost testing started (need to test with blobs)
Devnet 9 testing continues, MEV-Boost testing started (need to test with blobs)
* Devnet 10 ideally launches next week, once KZG setup in CL specs/clients and devnet
9 testing complete
Devnet 10 ideally launches next week, once KZG setup in CL specs/clients and devnet 9
testing complete
* EVM Object Format (EOF) status update
EVM Object Format (EOF) status update
* Discussions on priorities/timeline for EOF & Verkle, whether to ever include EOF and
L1/L2 EVM divergence
Discussions on priorities/timeline for EOF & Verkle, whether to ever include EOF and
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.89% has reduced again but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
Arbitrum delegates voted against incentives for Lido
ðŸš¨ Lido at 31.89% has reduced again but still far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Arbitrum delegates voted against incentives for Lido
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth ~84%
supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any
client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality Blockprint (CL client diversity
analysis) updated to include accuracy data
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth ~84% supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Blockprint (CL client diversity analysis) updated to include accuracy data
Consensus layer: Prysm at 45%, any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Blockprint (CL client diversity analysis) updated to include accuracy data
* Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of US/Can/EU
Geographic diversity needed for stakers & nodes , particularly outside of US/Can/EU
Layer 1
* PÃ©ter SzilÃ¡gyi (Geth): proposal for eth/69 to improve transaction propagation, no
hard fork required
PÃ©ter SzilÃ¡gyi (Geth): proposal for eth/69 to improve transaction propagation, no hard
fork required
* Proposal for time restricted transaction execution , add a minStartTime field to
transactions
Proposal for time restricted transaction execution , add a minStartTime field to
* Verkle Tree cryptography implemented in Zig
Verkle Tree cryptography implemented in Zig
For Stakers
* Beacon chain churn limit increased to 13 per epoch (Dencun EIP7514 reduces to 8 for
deposits)
Beacon chain churn limit increased to 13 per epoch (Dencun EIP7514 reduces to 8 for
* ~9k solo stakers : estimate based on deposit addresses interacting with smart
contracts
~9k solo stakers : estimate based on deposit addresses interacting with smart
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Teku v23.10.0 : attestation duty calculation performance
improvements
Consensus layer:
* Teku v23.10.0 : attestation duty calculation performance improvements
* Execution layer: Besu v23.10.0 : Layered transaction pool now default Erigon v2.52.0
: fixes Otterscan v2.1.0 alpha : adds indexer for withdrawals per address Geth v1.13.3
: updates Pebble to fix occasional IO/CPU runaway
Execution layer:
* Besu v23.10.0 : Layered transaction pool now default
Besu v23.10.0 : Layered transaction pool now default
* Erigon v2.52.0 : fixes Otterscan v2.1.0 alpha : adds indexer for withdrawals per
address
Erigon v2.52.0 : fixes
* Otterscan v2.1.0 alpha : adds indexer for withdrawals per address
* Geth v1.13.3
Geth v1.13.3
Research
* Vitalikâ€™s proposed staking design changes to give delegators power to choose nodes &
participate in consensus, improving decentralization & reducing consensus overhead
Vitalikâ€™s proposed staking design changes to give delegators power to choose nodes &
* Minimum viable issuance (only issue ETH that is strictly needed for security):
benefits & drawbacks
Minimum viable issuance (only issue ETH that is strictly needed for security):
* PEPC-Boost : out of protocol relay design which auctions top-of-block &
rest-of-block separately
PEPC-Boost : out of protocol relay design which auctions top-of-block & rest-of-block
separately
* Commitment-Satisfaction Committees : leverage attesters to enforce commitments for
PEPC
Commitment-Satisfaction Committees : leverage attesters to enforce commitments for
* Proposal for optional validator identification metadata
Proposal for optional validator identification metadata
Layer 2
* L2BEAT Build Your Own Rollup : simplified sovereign rollup for education purposes
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs (Informational) EIP7532 : Generation unit (64 epochs) EIP7534 :
Theorem-carrying-transaction
EIPs
* (Informational) EIP7532 : Generation unit (64 epochs)
(Informational) EIP7532 : Generation unit (64 epochs)
* EIP7534 : Theorem-carrying-transaction
EIP7534 : Theorem-carrying-transaction
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7533 : Public cross port (connect EVM networks) ERC7535
: ETH (native asset) tokenized vault (ERC4626)
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7533 : Public cross port (connect EVM networks)
ERC7533 : Public cross port (connect EVM networks)
ERC7535
Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF Round 3 applications are open
Applications for Optimismâ€™s RetroPGF Round 3 are open!
In this round 30 million OP will be allocated to the builders, artists, creators, and
educators who have demonstrated their impact in building the Optimism Collective.
Apply now , applications close October 23
Stuff for developers
* Hardhat-viem (plugin): use Viem library in new & existing Hardhat projects
Hardhat-viem (plugin): use Viem library in new & existing Hardhat projects
* Foundry test summary : use summary flag for concise table of test results
Foundry test summary : use summary flag for concise table of test results
* P256Verifier : Solidity contract for P256 signature verification, deployed on
mainnet
P256Verifier : Solidity contract for P256 signature verification, deployed on mainnet
* Vyper: titanoboa v0.1.8 (Vyper interpreter): adds Vyper v0.3.10 support, network
mode to deploy contracts, jupyter integration and coverage Snekmate v0.0.3 (Vyper
contracts): updated to Vyper v0.3.10, adds ERC2981 (NFT royalties)
Vyper:
* titanoboa v0.1.8 (Vyper interpreter): adds Vyper v0.3.10 support, network mode to
deploy contracts, jupyter integration and coverage
titanoboa v0.1.8 (Vyper interpreter): adds Vyper v0.3.10 support, network mode to
* Snekmate v0.0.3 (Vyper contracts): updated to Vyper v0.3.10, adds ERC2981 (NFT
royalties)
Snekmate v0.0.3 (Vyper contracts): updated to Vyper v0.3.10, adds ERC2981 (NFT
* Huff: Huff playground : Huff equivalent of evm.codes Tstore huff template : use
tload & tstore opcodes (in Dencun upgrade) via verbatim helper
Huff:
* Huff playground : Huff equivalent of evm.codes
Huff playground : Huff equivalent of evm.codes
* Tstore huff template : use tload & tstore opcodes (in Dencun upgrade) via verbatim
helper
Tstore huff template : use tload & tstore opcodes (in Dencun upgrade) via verbatim
* Ethers.js v6.8.0 : updated to latest noble crypto libraries
Ethers.js v6.8.0 : updated to latest noble crypto libraries
* Alchemy account kit : toolkit for ERC4337 account abstraction
Alchemy account kit : toolkit for ERC4337 account abstraction
* Swiss Knife send tx : UI to deploy contract bytecode
Swiss Knife send tx : UI to deploy contract bytecode
* Call this : transaction builder UI with shareable link, uses WhatsABI
Call this : transaction builder UI with shareable link, uses WhatsABI
* ZK Hunt : RTS-like onchain PvP game built using MUD and circom
ZK Hunt : RTS-like onchain PvP game built using MUD and circom
Security
* Wise Lending exploit front run by MEV searcher c0ffeebabe
Wise Lending exploit front run by MEV searcher c0ffeebabe
* Threshold tBTC vulnerabilities disclosed , DoS vector and redemption mechanism
design flaw
Threshold tBTC vulnerabilities disclosed , DoS vector and redemption mechanism design
flaw
Ecosystem
* ETHRome hackathon winners
Enterprise
* BlackRock used tokenized money market fund as collateral in OTC derivatives trade on
JPMorganâ€™s Onyx
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.3 to 47.7 gwei, with 7.4 gwei average Negative
issuance currently at 21.3 gwei 10.5k ETH net issuance this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 4.3 to 47.7 gwei, with 7.4 gwei average
* Negative issuance currently at 21.3 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 21.3 gwei
* 10.5k ETH net issuance this week
10.5k ETH net issuance this week
* ETHUSD : $1,529 - $1,646, currently $1,549
ETHUSD : $1,529 - $1,646, currently $1,549
* ETHBTC : currently 0.058 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.058 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* Farcaster (social network) now permissionless on Optimism Warpcast cryptoless
signups on iOS
* Warpcast cryptoless signups on iOS
Job Listings
* eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
eBay Web3 team seeking Lead Solidity Engineer
* ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
ZK circuits engineer sought by EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team
* Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
Senior Operations Security Expert wanted by EF
* EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek a Technical Project Coordinator
* Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
Aave seek a UX Engineer and a Staff Rust Engineer
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup
at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* CFTC and FTC charge former Voyager CEO Stephen Ehrlich
CFTC and FTC charge former Voyager CEO Stephen Ehrlich
* SEC not appealing Grayscale ruling for spot Bitcoin ETF
SEC not appealing Grayscale ruling for spot Bitcoin ETF
General
* Tornado Cash compliance tool users please help the defense of Alex Pertsev in the
Netherlands
Tornado Cash compliance tool users please help the defense of Alex Pertsev in the
* HTX (formerly Huobi) stolen funds returned
HTX (formerly Huobi) stolen funds returned
* Contribute to Unirep (private & non-repudiable reputation system) ceremony
Contribute to Unirep (private & non-repudiable reputation system) ceremony
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-october-14-2023
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )

* Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH London hackathon
Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH London hackathon

Oct 27-29 â€“ ETH Miami festival & hackathon
* Oct 28-30 â€“ Paradigm CTF
Oct 28-30 â€“ Paradigm CTF
* Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
Oct 31 â€“ Road to Devcon grants deadline (max $1k for local meetups)
* Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
Nov 3-5 â€“ ETH Lisbon hackathon
* Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul)
Nov 13-19 â€“ Devconnect (Istanbul)
* Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
Nov 16-19 â€“ Pragma & ETHGlobal Istanbul
* Nov 18 â€“ Ethereum Costa Rica

* Dec 4-5 â€“ ETHVenice
